main event: Observation of a yellowish-white light of undetermined origin crossing in front of and above an airplane's line of flight at Oxnard Air Force Base.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be travelling at around 500 knots and maintained a horizontal flight path., Observers included Captain Kemo, who was landing the airplane and noticed the light's trajectory., The altitude of the light was indeterminate due to lack of reference objects., Other reports suggested the possibility of the lights being from aircraft, but the absence of sound and the erratic flight path discounted this theory., A total of five civilian and Air Force observers noted the light over a span of 66 seconds during the incident.
sighted object: a yellowish-white light in the sky
witness description: civilian and Air Force personnel, including a Civil Air Patrol member and Radar Observer
